attributes.action: Date of last Thursday clap for the keyworkers and NHS a bank holiday In UK
attributes.additional_details: The corona virus outbreak is a pandemic. The period of tragedy touched each and everyone somehow and many risked their lives to save the country, some unfortunately lost their lives. Just like our world wars, religious festivals and times of celebration, this should be considered as a very important time in the history of the UK.
attributes.background: I would like the government and parliament to understand the hard work and for everyone to be allowed a bank holiday to remember and appreciate how the country came together and the key workers risked their lives to save the country from COVID-19 as well as the people who died from deadly virus.

rejection.details:
Create a new Bank Holiday in recognition of the NHS and all its amazing workers: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/303882 

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here: 

www.gov.uk/coronavirus 

https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/ 

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support 

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
